com.mobiquitynetworks.ble
Class Beacon

java.lang.Object
  com.mobiquitynetworks.ble.Beacon
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Beacon>
public class Beacon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Beacon>, java.io.Serializable

This class represents a BLE device announcing iBeacon compatible packets. This class has a central role in the SDK: beacons are discovered, followed up: updated based on consecutive announcement packets, removed when are detected to be out of range and content is retrieved and cached for each of them.

In summary, much of the work that this SDK performs is somehow related to a Beacon object.

Following, you have a description of the possible states a beacon can get into:

  • Discovered: A beacon gets into this state at instantiation time and sits in this state until the next announcement is received.
  • Alive: A beacon gets into this state for every update received.
  • Reset: A beacon gets into this state when it's state gets reset.
  • Dropping packets: A beacon gets into this state when starts dropping packets as stated by the BeaconManager.
  • Dropping packets 2: A beacon gets into this state when keeps dropping packets as stated by the BeaconManager.
  • Out of range: A beacon gets into this state when times out as stated by the BeaconManager.

Author:
Enric Cecilla
See Also:
BeaconManager, Serialized Form

Field Detail

CreationTimestampComparatorAsc

public static final java.util.Comparator<Beacon> CreationTimestampComparatorAsc
Comparator class for Beacon lists based on creation time (ascending). The higher the value of the timestamp, the higher the index it gets.

CreationTimestampComparatorDesc

public static final java.util.Comparator<Beacon> CreationTimestampComparatorDesc
Comparator class for Beacon lists based on creation time (descending). The higher the value of the timestamp, the lower the index it gets.

DistanceComparatorAsc

public static final java.util.Comparator<Beacon> DistanceComparatorAsc
Comparator class for Beacon lists based on distance. Ordered ascending, the more distance the higher array index it will get.

DistanceComparatorDesc

public static final java.util.Comparator<Beacon> DistanceComparatorDesc
Comparator class for Beacon lists based on distance. Ordered descending, the more distance the lower index it will get.

belongsToMobiquityNetworks

public boolean belongsToMobiquityNetworks()
Checks if this beacon belongs to Mobiquity Networks Inc.

compareTo

public int compareTo(Beacon beacon)
Sorts beacon objects by distance from closest to furthest. Default sorting when no Comparator is supplied to the Collections.sort(java.util.List) method.

Ex: using sort will use this comparable method as default.

Collections.sort( myBeaconsList );

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Beacon>
See Also:
Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns if two beacon objects are equal based on id equality. The calculation of the id for a particular beacon is delegated to the Idresolver class.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object

getCreationTimestamp

public long getCreationTimestamp()
Gets the creation timestamp (UTC) for this beacon, which is the time in which the first announcement message was received. These timestamp values are intended to be compared among them.

Returns:
The creation timestamp as a UTC time value (ms).

Gets the elapsed time (ms) since the last announcement arrival.

getLastAnnouncementPeriod

public long getLastAnnouncementPeriod()
Returns the time period between the last two announcement arrivals. This time might be larger than the beacon's real announcement time (BAT) if advertisements were lost along the way because of radio conditions or other reasons. Typically this time will be a multiple of the real BAT with some jitter.

isStuck

public boolean isStuck()
Checks if this beacon object is stuck with no updates because the Bluedroid stack is not feeding new values into the scan callback. This behaviour is observed with some ble chipsets and is reported in Android kitkat 4.4.2 as a bug. Probably will be fixed with later Android versions.

newSnapShot

public Beacon newSnapShot()
Creates a new snapshot for this beacon.

Returns:
A new beacon created with the copy-constructor with all fields set with this beacon values, not null.

resetInTime

public void resetInTime()
Resets the state of this beacon as if it was recently discovered.

toString in class java.lang.Object

See Also:
Object.toString()

updateMeasure

public void updateMeasure(int rssi)
Updates the last rssi measure. Having received a new update value means the beacon state is ALIVE again.

Parameters:
rssi - Current received rssi value to update.
